intro: Cuphea salvadorensis, commonly known as the salvadorian cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Cuphea salvadorensis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
